TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit TreeNodeStyleCollection extends System.Web.UI.StateManagedCollection
Public NotInheritable Class TreeNodeStyleCollection Inherits StateManagedCollection
public ref class TreeNodeStyleCollection sealed : System::Web::UI::StateManagedCollection

Docs.summary: Represents a collection of objects that is in a control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyleCollection> class is used to store and manage a collection of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle> objects. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView.LevelStyles%2A> property, of type <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyleCollection>, stores the node styles for the individual levels of a tree.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView.LevelStyles%2A> property is an alternative to the individual style properties, such as the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView.NodeStyle%2A> property, that control node styles at different levels of the tree. The first style in the collection corresponds to the node style in the first level of the tree. The second style in the collection corresponds to the node style in the second level of the tree, and so on. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView.LevelStyles%2A> property is most often used to generate table of contents-style navigation menus where nodes at a certain level should have the same appearance, regardless of whether they have child nodes.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyleCollection> class inherits most of its members from the <xref:System.Web.UI.StateManagedCollection> class. For more information about the inherited members, see <xref:System.Web.UI.StateManagedCollection>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyleCollection> class to specify the style settings for the individual levels of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView> control. Notice that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView.LevelStyles%2A> property returns a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyleCollection> object.
[!code-aspx-csharp[TreeViewLevelStyles#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/TreeViewLevelStyles/CS/treeviewlevelstylescs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[TreeViewLevelStyles#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/TreeViewLevelStyles/VB/treeviewlevelstylesvb.aspx#1)]

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyleCollection.Add%2A> method to append the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle> object to the end of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyleCollection> object.
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyleCollection> allows you to add `null`, as well as duplicate <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle> objects.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyleCollection.Contains%2A> method to determine whether a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle> object is contained in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyleCollection> object. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyleCollection.Contains%2A> method is commonly used to test for the existence of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle> object before performing a task, such as adding or removing the node from the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyleCollection.CopyTo%2A> method to copy the contents of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyleCollection> object into the specified zero-based array of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle> objects. Items are copied starting at the specified index of the target array. You can then use the array to access the items in the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyleCollection.IndexOf%2A> method to determine the zero-based index of the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle> object in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyleCollection> object. If the node is not in the collection, the method returns -1.
> [!NOTE] > If the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle> object appears multiple times in the collection, the index of the first occurrence is returned.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyleCollection.Insert%2A> method to insert the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle> object into the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyleCollection> object at the specified zero-based index.
As an alternative, you can append a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle> object to the end of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyleCollection> by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyleCollection.Add%2A> method.

.method public hidebysig instance void Remove(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle style) cil managed

Docs.summary: Removes the specified object from the object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyleCollection.Remove%2A> method to remove the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle> object from the collection. The indexes of the remaining objects are updated to be consecutive.
As an alternative, you can remove a node at specific index by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyleCollection.RemoveAt%2A> method. You can also remove every node in the collection by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.StateManagedCollection.Clear%2A> method.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void RemoveAt(int32 index) cil managed

Docs.param: The zero-based index location of the to remove.
Docs.summary: Removes the object at the specified index location from the object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyleCollection.RemoveAt%2A> method to remove the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle> object at the specified zero-based index location from a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyleCollection> object. All the items that are located after the removed node are then moved up one level to fill the vacant position in the tree structure. The indexes of the moved items are also updated.
As an alternative, you can remove a specific <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyle> object by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeStyleCollection.Remove%2A> method. You can also remove every node in the collection by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeCollection.Clear%2A> method.
